abstract: Data compiled by United Nations shows that Taliban has spread through more of Afghanistan than at any point since American ouster of group in 2001; assessment is at odds with statement made by American commander Gen John F Campbell in testimony to Congress.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan; Alissa J. Rubin, Ahmad Shakib and Mujib Mashal from Kabul; and Najim Rahim from Kunduz, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The data appears at odds with the assessment by Gen. John F. Campbell, the coalition’s American commander, in his testimony to Congress last week.

headline.main: Afghan Taliban’s Reach Is Widest Since 2001, U.N. Says
headline.print_headline: Taliban’s Reach in Afghanistan Is Widest Since 2001, U.N. Data Shows
